title: THE BEAT OF OUR HEARTS..
text:
Can your heart beat with mine? 
I see a lot of interesting ads here on Craigslist. People looking for the next big things whether that be an affair, a hook up, a relationship, or those who are looking for an ego boost and steal pictures.

About four years ago, I lost my partner of 12 years. Yes, we were really young when we got together; and yes, I just recently turned 32. He died honorably while serving this country. 

In the 12 years we were together I learned many things. I learned that a relationship is a risk. You don't need to get on 60 dates to know if someone is right for you. Why? Because you are going to spend the rest of your life getting to know someone. You know, it was after 4 years that I actually knew my husband's favorite color. People think they can have life figured out before they settle down, but that will never happen.

People these days are so picky that I guarantee they have missed out on many opportunities at love; yet, they will sit on social media and complain because they are alone. People are humans, and a human life is a beautiful thing no matter their age, color, weight, or their body. 
Love is seeing past flaws. We all have flaws and imperfections. From what I see on Craigslist, not too many people can see past flaws with all these laundry lists of credentials for someone to be able to contact them. 

Love sees no wrong. There were so many times my hubby did something foolish, but I always defended him to the ground. There were times when I was wrong, and I admitted it. There were times when I was right, but would just laugh and agree to disagree. 
We kept our personal life personal. When things went wrong we dealt with them as a team. We didn't post things on Facebook for people to butt in and give their opinion about something. 
There were times I wanted to run over than man with a damn bus, he was so ornery. But I would look into his eyes as they gleamed at me. You could see the depth of his love in his eyes.

I am a 50's WM who prefers the company of a younger man - just one. Son - in that you are a somewhat shy, submissive type of person who likes others to make the major decisions and looks to them for guidance and mentoring.

Partner - in that you enjoy traveling together, spending time in each other's company and consider me first in your life, as I would consider you.

Sexually, I want someone who derives genuine pleasure in taking care of their man. Not a slave who wishes to be punished or someone who wants to be degraded, etc. But someone who gets a thrill out of knowing they are desired, that their body is bringing pleasure to someone they care for. I would prefer that you be hip or slim. A bit more is okay, but you should want to work with me in getting into shape if so. I would prefer you to be smooth, whether naturally or willing to become so. I generally prefer someone my height to very short - waifish even.

We can explore sexual and social fantasies and desires - yes, some fantasies extend beyond the bedroom - how we wish to be treated, the image we project, how people see us - all can lead to a greater emotional fulfillment and sexual satisfaction when we return home - or wherever we choose to become intimate.

We will not exchange nude photos online, that revelation is reserved for face-to-face meetings. I am a casual naturist and enjoy going to nude beaches and being naked at home and other outdoor locations. I have friends who may visit and also divest themselves of their clothing - though this is not a sexual thing.

If any of this sounds interesting, and you like the idea of working toward the goal of living together under my roof and my rules, drop me a line. Actually, drop me several. I value the ability to express yourself. If you can't articulate your interests, desires and expectations to me, then I have little chance of making you truly content in our life together.

If you find yourself wondering just what is intended behind my words, are trying to psychoanalyze me or find a hidden agenda - don't bother answering. I'm about as open a person as you're likely to find - I am always honest about my feelings and desires - I only ask that you be willing to accept what I say rather than looking for something behind the words.
